revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Nigel Botterill | image = File:Nigel_Botterill.png | alt = Nigel Botterill | caption = Nigel Botterill, Founder of Entrepreneurs Circle | birth_name = | birth_date = 9 January 1966 | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = [[United Kingdom|British]] | other_names = | organization = Entrepreneurs Circle | known_for = Educating, motivating, helping and inspiring business owners to achieve more than they ever thought possible. | website = https://EntrepreneursCircle.org | occupation = Author, Entrepreneur }} '''Nigel Botterill''' (born January 1966) is a [[British people|British]] [[entrepreneur]], marketer, author, speaker and business mentor.<ref>[http://www.birminghampost.co.uk/business/nigel-botterills-mission-revive-west-3920453 "Nigel Botterill's mission to revive the West Midlands high streets"] ''Birmingham Post'', 17 June, 2011</ref> He is founder and chief executive of a number of businesses including the UK's fastest growing franchise, thebestof<ref>[http://www.managementtoday.co.uk/news/1039414/Week-Nigel-Botterill-thebestof/ "My Week: Nigel Botterill of thebestof"] ''Management Today''. Retrieved 2014-12-30.</ref><ref>[http://www.thefranchisemagazine.net/page/thebestof/thebestof-wins-e-company-of-year.php "TheBestOf wins E-Company of the year"] ''The Franchise Magazine''. Retrieved 2014-12-30.</ref> and most notably, the Entrepreneurs Circle.<ref>[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/businessclub/business-club-video/marketing-and-communications-se/8438109/Entrepreneurs-Circle.html "Entrepreneur's Circle"] '' The Telegraph''. Retrieved 2014-12-30.</ref><ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/small-business-network/2014/may/08/small-business-leader-entrepreneurs-circle "Small business leader: Nigel Botterill, Entrepreneurs Circle"] ''The Guardian''. Retrieved 2014-12-30.</ref>
Botterill left a successful corporate career to self-employment in 2003. Since then he has founded nine separate businesses in both the B2C and B2B markets.
In 2010 Botterill launched the Entrepreneurs Circle the UK's largest membership organisation dedicated to helping businesses to grow<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://entrepreneurscircle.org/|title=Entrepreneurs Circle - Achieve more than you ever thought possible!|website=Entrepreneurs Circle|language=en-US|access-date=2018-10-01}}</ref> and in February 2011, he published his first business book ''The Botty Rules'',<ref>[http://www.businesswings.co.uk/articles/Business-book-published-on-Twitter "Entrepreneur publishes book on Twitter"] ''Business Wings''. Retrieved 2014-12-30.</ref> which reached number two in the [[Sunday Telegraph]] best-sellers list.<ref>[http://www.managementtoday.co.uk/news/1086012/books-three-kind-unleash-inner-guru/ "Books: Three of a kind - Unleash your inner guru"] ''Management Today''. Retrieved 2014-12-30.</ref>
== Early Life == Botterill was born in January 1966 in [[Leeds]], United Kingdom. His father was a police officer and his mother worked as a switchboard operator.
== Corporate Career == Botterill began his working life at [[Barclays|Barclays Bank]] in 1982 at the age of 16. His Barclays career lasted for 18 years and saw Botterill responsible for building UK call centres and setting up Internet Banking Services.
In 2000 Botterill took the role of Marketing Director at Singlepoint (part of the [[Phones4U]] empire) working alongside [[John Caudwell]]. He began working with another entrepreneur, [[Hamish Ogston]] in late 2001 as Managing Director of Card Protection Plan.
== Business Ventures ==
=== N5 Ltd. === In 2003 Botterill left the corporate world. Later in the same year, he set up his own marketing consultancy, N5 Ltd.
=== MyMag === At the same time as he was launching N5 Ltd, Botterill’s wife Sue set up a local community magazine with paid-for ads from local businesses and was soon generating a sizeable income each month whilst looking after the couple’s children. The success of Mrs Botterill's magazine business led to Nigel Botterill firing all his consultancy clients and shifting his focus on to a new business called MyMag helping other people accomplish what his wife had done. The 'business in a box' was launched from Nigel's spare bedroom in June 2004.
=== thebestof === In 2005, with the growing success of MyMag, Botterill set up thebestof which was one of the very first online business directories and became the fastest UK franchise ever to get to 200 franchisees<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.startuptv.co.uk/directory/business-opportunities/thebestof/thebestof-interview.html|title=Thebestof Franchise Opportunities - thebestof - Startup TV|website=www.startuptv.co.uk|access-date=2018-10-02}}</ref>. This transition was recognised by the award for Innovative Company of the Year which was awarded to Botterill at the Fast Growth Business Awards in 2008. thebestof also ranked No. 3 in the [[Sunday Times]] Tech Track 100 in 2007 and won the award for Best e-company of the Year at the Sharp Edge Awards presented by [[Duncan Bannatyne]].
=== Raring2Go === Botterill launched Raring2Go in April 2006. A local magazine which was a guide on what to do and where to go with your children. They printed over 4 million magazines a year and sold the business in December 2008.
=== MyLittleWrapper === My Little Wrapper was a personalized chocolate wrapper business launched in February 2008. It generated over a million pounds of turnover in its first year.
=== Explosive Marketing === Explosive Marketing was launched in January 2009 as a marketing service for restaurants. It was sold a few years later.
=== MySMB === Botterill and his team launched MySMB in June 2009. It was a package which taught people how to become social media managers for other businesses.
== Entrepreneurs Circle == The Entrepreneurs Circle was launched on a webinar in March 2010 with 193 members joining in the first 24 hours. Over the next eight years tens of thousands of business owners would join the Entrepreneurs Circle.
=== Agency === In 2017 Botterill and his team recognised the clear and substantial desire of members of the Entrepreneurs Circle to have their marketing 'done-for-them' and so Botterill launched his own marketing agency; LUDIFY (Let Us Do It For You).
== Books == [[File:Botty's_Rules.jpg|thumb|250x250px|Botty's Rules]] In February 2011, Botterill published his first business book ''The Botty Rules'' which became a [[The Sunday Telegraph|Sunday Telegraph]] best-seller.{{cn|date=November 2018}}
== Awards == In addition to the awards his business’ have won,<ref>[http://startups.co.uk/fast-growth-business-awards/innovative-business-of-the-year-2008/ "Innovative Business of the Year 2008"] ''Startups''. Retrieved 2014-12-30.</ref><ref>[http://www.fasttrack.co.uk/fasttrack/leagues/tech100leaguetable.asp?siteID=3&yr=2007&area1=99&sort=num&x=20&y=20 "The Sunday Times Tech Track 100 league table 2007"] ''The Sunday Times''. Retrieved 2014-12-30.</ref> Botterill has also picked up several accolades for his contributions to the business world. He won the BT Essence of the Entrepreneur Award<ref>[http://www.midlandsbusinessnews.co.uk/top-midland-businessman-guest-of-honour-at-solihull-speech-day/ "Top Midland businessman guest of honour at Solihull Speech Day"] ''Midlands Business News''. Retrieved 2014-12-30.</ref>{{Unreliable source?|reason=Invites user submissions. Contact us notes "Press releases and news items submitted are reviewed as to their news value and suitability for our audience", but PR is not labeled and source is not disclosed.|date=March 2016}} and was also Highly Commended at the [[National Business Book Award|National Business Awards]] in the Entrepreneur of the Year category in 2007 and again a finalist in 2012.<ref>[http://www.nationalbusinessawards.co.uk/files/nba_judges_comments_14_08_12.pdf "The Finalists – the Judges Comments"] ''National Business Awards''. Retrieved 2014-12-30.</ref> Botterill was also the first ever non-[[United States|American]] (and two time winner) to pick up the GKIC Marketer of the Year award.<ref>[http://media.info-marketing.org/journal/200610_Journal.pdf "My Mag Opportunity"] ''Information Marketing Insiders' Journal''. Retrieved 2014-12-30.</ref>
== Personal Life == Botterill lives in [[Solihull]], [[United Kingdom]] with his wife Sue and his four children; Cameron, Elliott, Tabitha and Fabian and their [[Miniature Schnauzer]]; Monty.
He is an avid [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] fan, amateur golfer and has seen the musical production of [[Les Misérables (musical)|Les Misérables]] 37 times.{{cn|date=November 2018}}
==References== {{Reflist|3}}
==External links== * [http://www.nigelbotterill.com/ Entrepreneur's Circle] Official site
{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2011}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Botterill, Nigel}} [[Category:Articles created via the Article Wizard]] [[Category:1966 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Marketing people]] [[Category:British businesspeople]] [[Category:Business ownership]] __INDEX__

revision.text:
{{Orphan|date=November 2015}}
'''''Nina Iraq''''' is a bilingual magazine for [[Iraq]]i women everywhere, running articles mostly on women’s empowerment themes.<ref>http://www.unwomen.org/en/what-we-do/economic-empowerment</ref> It is published a couple of times a year as a hard copy magazine, with digital publication and interaction on the Website as the live feed. ''Nina-Iraq'' is published by NGO the Private Sector Development Centre in Iraq (PSDC).<ref name="PSDC">[http://psdc-iraq.org PSDC]</ref> with support from the [[World Bank Group]] for the first issue and ongoing support from Chamber Trade Sweden <ref name="CTS">[http://chambertradesweden.se/ CTS]</ref> into 2015 and beyond. Nina-Iraq focusses on economic empowerment opportunities by showcasing real voices through interviews and stories in both English and Arabic. The printed magazine is fed by features from the Nina-Iraq website.
== History == Designed to create trade links and shared expertise in a digital Iraqi homeland, Nina aims to inspire collaboration by 5 million Iraqi diaspora with in country Iraqi's. The distribution of 20,000 magazines in Iraq and internationally occurs through private sector organisations and chambers of trade - as well as online interaction. Nina was created in response to calls to action such as co-founder Madeleine White's report on Women in the Private Sector in MENA.<ref name="Women in Private Sector Report">[https://www.wiltonpark.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/WP1321-Report.pdf MENA Wilton Park Report]</ref>
=== Winter 2013 === Nina gets a name and a brand. Nina is one of the names of Goddess "[[Inana]]", representing fertility, beauty and love to the ancient people of Mesopotamia. The Goddess appeared for the first time in the lands of "Sumer" 5,000 years ago. She was symbolized in cuneiform writing by an octagon star that referred to the planet Venus. She also came to symbolize the desire of communication between man and woman; from her body, a new life arises. Nina is a shortening on Inana, can be pronounced used in English and Arabic and has no modern religious connotations, instead referencing Iraq's rich past.
=== Spring 2014 === In April Issue 1 was launched in London in the House of Commons <ref name="Nina-Iraq Launch London">[http://nina-iraq.com/2014/05/22/nina-launches-in-the-house-of-commons-in-london-29th-april Nina House of Commons Launch]</ref> by [http://lorelyburt.org.uk/en/article/2014/825331/female-business-champion-appointed-to-help-new-and-growing-firms Lorely Burt MP], with support by ABCC Chair [[Elizabeth Symons, Baroness Symons of Vernham Dean|Baroness Symonds of Vernham Dean]]. In May Issue 1 was launched with Chamber Trade Sweden and the Swedish diaspora Stockholm.<ref name="Nina-Iraq Launch Stockholm">[http://nina-iraq.com/2014/05/22/sweden-celebrates-nina-19th-may Nina Stockholm Launch]</ref>
=== Summer 2014 === The Iraqi launch took place at the Grand Millennium Hotel in Suleimania in early June with support from Asiacell.<ref name="Iraqi Launch">[http://www.iraq-businessnews.com/2014/06/10/nina-launches-in-iraq Asiacell’s Chairman Faruk Rasool supports Iraqi launch]</ref> The incursion of Isis, meant focus on the online edition of Nina. Nina's poem was written in order to create a united vision for all the volunteers disheartened by the invasion of ISIS, who were worried about Nina's relevance and future.
== Features == Nina-Iraq’s contributors are normal people, not journalists, although some special interviews are professionally done. For example, business opportunities around environmental sustainability, health and oil and gas are presented, offering industry for Iraq and Iraqi Kurdistan. Contributors can upload their stories directly via Share My Story, Email or work to get journalistic support via corporate volunteer portal, [[Benefacto]]. Examples include a call to action by 14-year-old Mariam,<ref>http://nina-iraq.com/2014/09/23/living-in-the-future-iraq/</ref> a Women in Islam story by finance expert Natalie Schoon and an interview with global Vital Voices Winner Suaad Allami.<ref>http://nina-iraq.com/2014/09/18/women-in-islam-a-wider-perspective/</ref> Microsoft's masr ta3mal education and Aspire Woman Mentoring platforms can be accessed directly. There is also a business register on Nina's Directory.
== Particular characteristics == All submitted features are translated into either Arabic or English, depending on submission language in order to create a shared cultural dialogue to a wider audience. By focusing so strongly on women, there is a question however, whether wider political and social issues are being sufficiently addressed through Nina. As a women's magazine it has also been confused with a lifestyle or beauty magazine.
==References== {{Reflist}}
== External links == * [http://nina-iraq.com nina-iraq.com] (Official Site English) * [http://arabic.nina-iraq.com arabic.nina-iraq.com] (Official Site Arabic) * [http://www.iraq-businessnews.com/2014/05/01/nina-iraq-com-nation-building-for-iraqi-women-launches-this-week/ Nina launch announced in Iraq Business News] * [http://www.bayt.com/en/learn-center-details/?lc_id=1585561%20 Nina on Bayt.com] * [http://forum.aspirewoman.com/yaf_postst1040_Is-Architecture-the-Profession-for-You.aspx%20 Nina on Microsoft's Aspire Woman forum] * [http://www.iraqiculturalcentre.co.uk/archives/3067%20 Nina launching in Iraqi Cultural Centre, London]
{{italic title}}

revision.text:
'''Mike Agbolade Adeniyi Ishola Paddy Adenuga''' or '''Paddy Adenuga''' (born June 21, 1984) is a Nigerian [[Businessperson|businessman]] and [[screenwriter]] born in [[London]], [[England]]. He is the son of Nigerian billionaire [[Mike Adenuga]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://punchng.com/nigerians-react-to-paddy-adenuga-chevrons-story/|title=Nigerians react to Paddy Adenuga Chevron’s story|work=Punch Newspapers|access-date=2018-06-23|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.pulse.ng/news/business/10-things-you-probably-did-not-know-about-paddy-adenuga-id7913785.html|title=10-things-you-probably-did-not-know-about-paddy-adenuga|last=Oyeniyi|first=Adegoke|access-date=2018-06-23|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://independent.ng/is-paddy-adenuga-really-ready/|title=You are being redirected...|website=independent.ng|access-date=2018-06-23}}</ref>
== Early life and education == Born in [[London, England]] to [[Mike Adenuga]] Jr. from [[Ijebu Igbo]] in [[Ogun State]] and Emelia Marquis of [[Calabar]] descent from [[Cross River State]]. At the age of 10, Paddy Adenuga relocated from [[Lagos|Lagos, Nigeria]] to [[Harlingen, Texas]] in the [[Rio Grande Valley]] to attend the [[Marine Military Academy]]. After 3 years at [[Marine Military Academy]], he attended [[The Tenney School]] in [[Houston|Houston, Texas]]. By early 1998, he graduated from high school at the very tender age of 13.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.pulse.ng/news/business/10-things-you-probably-did-not-know-about-paddy-adenuga-id7913785.html|title=10-things-you-probably-did-not-know-about-paddy-adenuga|last=Oyeniyi|first=Adegoke|access-date=2018-06-23|language=en-US}}</ref>
Still at the age of 13, Paddy Adenuga started his university education at the [[University of Massachusetts Boston|University of Massachusetts,]] studying Business Administration and then thereafter, transferred to [[Northeastern University]] where he graduated with a Bachelors in Business Management in 2002 at the age of 18.
== Career == Paddy Adenuga initially worked at his family owned agglomerate company, The Mike Adenuga Group, from 2002 to 2006. He was the Group Executive Director of [[Globacom|GLO]] and also the upstream exploration & oil production company, [[Conoil|ConOil Producing]]. In 2006, he left the Mike Adenuga Group and moved to London to setup an oil brokering firm with a business partner called Cayne & Cayne. They brokered supplies of refined petroleum products to Nigerian oil firms. In 2009, Paddy returned to the Mike Adenuga Group in [[Lagos]], [[Nigeria]] in an even more senior capacity as the co-CEO of [[Globacom|GLO]] and CEO of [[Conoil|ConOil]] Producing.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://sunnewsonline.com/is-paddy-adenuga-feeling-bluesy/|title=Is Paddy Adenuga feeling bluesy? - The Sun News|date=2018-01-13|work=The Sun News|access-date=2018-06-23|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.premiumtimesng.com/business/business-data/257368-takeaways-paddy-adenugas-trojan-gambit-chevron-netherlands-tope-fasua.html|title=Takeaways From Paddy Adenuga's Trojan Gambit For Chevron Netherlands, By Tope Fasua - Premium Times Nigeria|date=2018-02-01|work=Premium Times Nigeria|access-date=2018-06-23|language=en-GB}}</ref>
In 2012, he then returned to London and set up The Catalan Corporation, an investment company.
== Notable achievements == Under his leadership, GLO significantly increased its national cell tower coverage in [[Nigeria]], [[Ghana]], & [[Benin|Benin Republic]], increased its overall revenue, and embraced new technologies to enhance customer experience and service delivery. In 2011, he led [[Conoil|ConOil']]<nowiki/>s $1.3 billion bid for Shell’s OML 30 oil block in Nigeria.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.yabaleftonline.ng/started-university-graduated-18-paddy-adenuga/|title="I started University at 13 and graduated at 18" — Paddy Adenuga - YabaLeftOnline|date=2018-01-25|work=YabaLeftOnline|access-date=2018-06-23|language=en-US}}</ref>
In 2013, Paddy Adenuga organized an almost successful acquisition of the entire business and assets of [[Chevron Corporation|Chevron]] in the [[Netherlands]] - he was 29 years old at the time.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pmnewsnigeria.com/2018/01/30/globacom-boss-son-paddy-adenuga-nearly-acquired-chevron-netherlands/|title=How Globacom boss' son Paddy Adenuga nearly acquired Chevron Netherlands - PM NEWS Nigeria|date=2018-01-30|work=PM NEWS Nigeria|access-date=2018-06-23|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://punchng.com/nigerians-react-to-paddy-adenuga-chevrons-story/|title=Nigerians react to Paddy Adenuga Chevron’s story|work=Punch Newspapers|access-date=2018-06-23|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.thecable.ng/paddy-adenuga-nearly-bought-chevron-netherlands-long-read|title=Paddy Adenuga: How I NEARLY bought Chevron Netherlands (long read) - TheCable|date=2018-01-30|work=TheCable|access-date=2018-06-23|language=en-US}}</ref>
Paddy Adenuga has been a screenwriter from the age of 15 and finished his fifth screenplay, “''Waterloo''”, in the summer of 2017.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://techpoint.ng/2018/02/02/paddy-adenuga-chevron-netherlands/|title=Social Media Roundup: A billionaire, a lion and the north sea|website=techpoint.ng|language=en-US|access-date=2018-06-23}}</ref>

revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = <!-- include middle initial, if not specified in birth_name --> | image = Paek Son-haeng portrait.jpg<!-- just the filename, without the File: or Image: prefix or enclosing [[brackets]] --> | alt = | caption = | birth_name = <!-- only use if different from name --> | birth_date = 1848 November<!-- {{Birth date and age|YYYY|MM|DD}} or {{Birth-date and age|birth date†}} for living people supply only the year unless the exact date is already widely published, as per WP:DOB --> | birth_place = Chung-kuyŏk, [[Pyongyang]]; or [[Suwon]] | death_date = 1933<!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} or {{Death-date and age|death date†|birth date†}} --> | death_place = | nationality = | other_names = | occupation = | years_active = | known_for = Businesswoman and philanthropist | notable_works = }} {{korean name|[[Baek|Paek]]}} {{Infobox Korean name |hangul=백선행 |hanja=白善行 |rr=Baek Seon-haeng |mr=Paek Sŏnhaeng }} '''Paek Son-haeng''' (1848 November – 1933) was a [[Korean people|Korean]] businesswoman known for her [[philanthropy]]. The name "Son Haeng" means virtuous deeds, and was a nickname bestowed on her due to her contributions. North Korean sources claim that she was born in modern-day Chung-kuyŏk, [[Pyongyang]], but South Korean sources claim that she was born in [[Suwon]].<ref>North: {{cite web|url=http://www.uriminzokkiri.com/KrOne_magj/news/2006/07-01/2-4.htm|title=인덕높은 애국자로 내세워주시여|work=Uriminzokkiri.com|accessdate=2006-08-03}} South: {{cite web|url=http://100.naver.com/100.nhn?docid=72683|title=백선행|work=Naver encyclopedia|accessdate=2006-08-03}}</ref> She was widowed at the age of 16 or 20, and spent the rest of her life saving money while spending very little. Regardless of her place of birth, she spent most of her life in Pyongyang, where most of her donations were made.
Paek has often been used by the North Korean regime as an example of a good capitalist, and contrasted to the majority of capitalists who were miserly and non-patriotic. She is mentioned in [[Kim Il Sung]]'s ''[[With the Century]]'' as someone respected by the people as "a great war hero" due to her success in making money under the Japanese regime.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uriminzokkiri.com/Newspaper/english/Books/Segi/Segi1/htm/36.htm|title=5. The Song of the River Amnok|accessdate=2006-08-03}}</ref> In July 2006, her memorial stone was rediscovered and restored in Pyongyang.
Paek made her first major donation after turning 61 in 1908 (see [[East Asian age reckoning]]), when she supported the construction of the Paeksŏn Bridge across the [[Taedong River]]. In 1922, she built a three-story public assembly hall in Pyongyang. She donated land to the [[Kwangson School]], a public school in Pyongyang, in 1923, and to the [[Changdok School]] in 1924. Thereafter she also provided land and an endowment to the school run by [[Samuel Austin Moffet]], and also provided large amounts land to the [[Sunghyon School]] in Pyongyang. In 1925, she donated her entire fortune to charity groups.
The [[Korea under Japanese rule|Japanese colonial government]] offered her an award for her contributions, but she refused.{{Citation needed|date=June 2007}}
==References== {{portal|Biography|Korea}} {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.kcna.co.jp/item/2006/200608/news08/02.htm#10 Announcement] at [[Korean Central News Agency]] *[http://www.uriminzokkiri.com/KrOne_magj/news/2006/07-01/2-4.htm Announcement] at [[Uriminzokkiri]] {{ko icon}} *[http://www.naenara.com.kp/en/book/new_window.php?10+10068 ''Paek Son Haeng Memorial Hall'' picture album] at [[Naenara]]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Paek, Son Haeng}} [[Category:1848 births]] [[Category:1933 deaths]] [[Category:Joseon Dynasty people]] [[Category:Korean businesspeople]] [[Category:Korean philanthropists]] [[Category:Korea under Japanese rule]] [[Category:People from Pyongyang]] [[Category:Korean women in business]]

of the industrial parc in [[Montreal]] <!-- Location --> | coordinates = {{coord|45.481944|-73.540278|region:CA-QC|display=inline,title}} | subdivision_type = [[List of countries|Country]] | Montreal|Borough]] | subdivision_name3 = [[Le Sud-Ouest]] | established_title = | established_date = | government_type = | government_footnotes = | leader_title = | leader_name = <!-- Area --> | unit_pref = Metric | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = | area_total_sq_mi = | area_land_km2 = | area_land_sq_mi = | area_water_km2 = | area_water_sq_mi = | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = <!-- Population --> | population_footnotes = | population_total = | population_as_of = | population_density_km2 = | population_density_sq_mi = <!-- General information --> | timezone = | utc_offset = | timezone_DST = | utc_offset_DST = <!-- Area/postal codes & others --> | postal_code_type = | postal_code = | area_code = | website = | footnotes = }} The '''Parc d'entreprises de la Pointe-Saint-Charles''', formerly known as the '''Montreal Technoparc''' and '''Adacport''',<ref>http://www.ville.montreal.qc.ca/pls/portal/docs/page/librairie_en/documents/LettreGeraldTremblayChefspartispoliEng.pdf — letter from Gerald Tremblay to Stephen Harper asking for federal government support for decontamination</ref> is an [[industrial park]] and former industrial dump in the [[Pointe-Saint-Charles]] neighbourhood of [[Montreal]], between the [[pont Champlain|Champlain]] and [[pont Victoria|Victoria]] bridges.<ref>http://www.canada.com/montrealgazette/news/story.html?id=76d95baa-6189-4060-88c7-2e5e452f95fd — Montreal Gazette article about contamination at the site.</ref>
==History== The site was formerly marshland adjacent to the [[St. Lawrence River]]. It was used as a landfill and dumpsite from 1866 until 1966, and then was paved to serve as a parking lot for [[Expo 67]] and was named ''Autoparc Victoria''. Following the Expo, it briefly served as the site of the [[Victoria STOLport]], or ''ADACport'' in French.

revision.comment: Rescuing 2 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v1.6.5)
revision.text:
'''Phase-jitter modulation (PJM)''' is a modulation method<ref>[http://www.wipo.int/pctdb/en/wo.jsp?wo=1999034526 WO/1999/034526 "Transmitter and Method for Transmitting Data"].</ref> specifically designed to meet the unique requirements of passive [[RFID]] tags. It has been adopted by the high-frequency RFID Air Interface Standard [[ISO/IEC 18000-3 MODE 2]] for high-speed bulk conveyor-fed item-level identification<ref>[http://www.iso.org/iso/iso_catalogue/catalogue_ics/catalogue_detail_ics.htm?csnumber=53424 ISO/IEC 18000-3 Section 8 "Table of characteristic differences between the MODES"].</ref> because of its demonstrably higher data rates. The MODE 2 PJM data rate is 423,75 kbit/s; 16 times faster than the alternative MODE 1 system [[ISO/IEC 18000|ISO/IEC 18000-3 MODE 1]] and the legacy HF system [[ISO/IEC 15693]].
== Method == PJM works by representing data as very small phase changes in the instantaneous phase of a carrier signal. PJM can be regarded as a very low-level [[phase-modulation]] (PM) signal where [[amplitude-modulation]] (AM) components are suppressed to provide a constant-modulus signal. Most of the power (greater than 99%) in a PJM signal is transmitted as an un-modulated carrier and conveys no information. Less than 1% of the transmitted power is used for conveying the modulated data.
Passive [[RFID]] tags have no internal power source and derive their power from an external power source, typically the interrogating signal generated by an RFID interrogator. The interrogation signal is required to both power and communicate with the RFID tag. For a PJM signal the un-modulated carrier component powers the passive tag and the low-level modulated component conveys data to the tag. The tag uses the un-modulated carrier signal as a phase reference for demodulating the data signal. There is no reduction in the transfer of power to the tag during PJM.
There are international<ref>[http://www.itu.int/net/home/index.aspx International Telecommunications Union (ITU)].</ref> and US<ref>[http://www.etsi.org/WebSite/Technologies/ShortRangeDevices.aspx ETSI EN 300 330-1].</ref><ref> [http://www.fcc.gov/oet/info/rules/ FCC Title 47 Part 15].</ref> regulations that restrict the spectrum of the transmitted interrogation signal used by any RFID system. These regulations mandate a spectral mask<ref>[http://www.erodocdb.dk/Docs/doc98/official/pdf/REC7003E.PDF ERC/REC 70-03].</ref> that restricts both the frequency and amplitude of the interrogation signal. For a PJM signal the powering signal and the modulated data signal components are decoupled allowing the spectrum of the PJM signal to be matched to the spectral mask defined under these regulations by suitable amplitude adjustment of the un-modulated carrier and encoding and/or filtering<ref>[http://www.wipo.int/pctdb/en/wo.jsp?wo=2008089507 WO/2008/089507 "Communication Method and Device"].</ref> of the modulated data signal.
== Applications == Primary applications are in RFID tags for use in gaming, healthcare, pharmaceuticals, document and media management.<ref> [http://www.medialine.de/media/uploads/projekt/medialine/docs/forschung/magazinreader/RFID_Journal_050609_Auszug_FOCUS.pdf RFID Journal] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110719060820/http://www.medialine.de/media/uploads/projekt/medialine/docs/forschung/magazinreader/RFID_Journal_050609_Auszug_FOCUS.pdf |date=2011-07-19 }}.</ref>
== References == <references />
== External links == *[https://web.archive.org/web/20080225210705/http://www.infineon.com/cms/de/product/channel.html?channel=ff80808112ab681d0112ab6969df01f2 Infineon.com] *[http://www.satovicinity.com/ Satovicinity.com]

revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Raphael H Cohen | birth_date = {{birth year and age|1953}} | residence = Geneva, Switzerland | nationality = Swiss | occupation = [[:wikt:principal#English-partner or owner|Principal]], Management Boosters, Professor, Academic director, Author, Speaker }}
'''Raphael Cohen''' (born 1953) is a professor, lecturer, author, serial entrepreneur and [[business angel]]. He has a PhD in economics from Switzerland.<ref>{{cite web|title=RAPHAEL COHEN SERIAL-ENTREPRENEUR and BUSINESS BOOSTER|url=http://getratex.ch/left3_1.html|work=Management Boosters|accessdate=14 June 2013}}</ref>
He is the owner and managing director of Getratex SA, as well as academic director of the entrepreneurship and business development specialization of the eMBA at the University of Geneva.<ref>{{cite web|title=Raphael Cohen - CEO at Getratex SA|url=http://www.world-entrepreneurship-forum.com/Communities/Members/Cohen-Raphael|work=World Entrepreneurship Forum|accessdate=14 June 2013}}</ref>
He has been managing an international group of companies since before earning his PhD in economics in 1982.
Raphael has come up with the IpOp Model, an approach to innovation and corporate entrepreneurship.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Raphael|first=Cohen|author2=Heribert Watzke Jerome Katz |title=USASBE 2010 Workshop -IpOp Model and Opportunity Case|year=2010|url=https://www.scribd.com/doc/59854046/USASBE-2010-Workshop-IpOp-Model-and-Opportunity-Case-2-8-6-3|accessdate=14 June 2013}}</ref> This model is one of several attempting to help companies in their innovation management.
==Life and early career== Cohen started his career at Getratex SA in 1975, where his first intrapreneurial opportunity was to create a new business unit to sell fashion wear. This unit eventually became one of the most dynamic licensees of Walt Disney as the first to sell Disney sportswear successfully to adults in North America and Europe. To reduce his exposure to the fashion industry, in 1980 he initiated a diversification, which led him to invest in several startups. Since he became a business angel Cohen has been involved in many businesses including tourist attractions, theming of public areas, surface treatments, financial derivatives, internet marketing, software, skin treatments, retail, real estate, construction and high-tech projects. As a trusted advisor for several large corporations he became an expert in corporate innovation and intrapreneurship.
==Career==
===Management Boosters=== Cohen started Management Boosters in 2001, as a division of Getratex SA, to provide corporate clients with consulting and training services focusing on the acquisition of competitive advantages. Management Boosters offers training, consulting, mentoring & coaching, facilitation and lecturing.
===University of Geneva === Since 2001, Cohen has been the academic co-director of the entrepreneurship specialization of the eMBA of the University of Geneva, Switzerland, to design and run the first MBA in continental Europe focusing on innovation, entrepreneurship and business development <ref>{{cite web|title=Hec Geneve|url=http://www.hec.unige.ch/index.php?option=com_k2&view=item&layout=item&id=126&Itemid=423&lang=fr|work=Website Of Universite De Geneve|accessdate=14 June 2013}}</ref>
==Academic contributions ==
===IpOp Model === Cohen developed the IpOp Model as a potential roadmap during the pre-project/ideation stage of seizing an opportunity. The model is meant to help innovators analyze and mature their idea to produce an opportunity case or a business plan to convince themselves and decision-makers, such as investors or management of the merits of the opportunity. <ref>{{cite web|title=Raphael Cohen CEO at Getratex SA|url=http://www.world-entrepreneurship-forum.com/Communities/Members/Cohen-Raphael|work=World Entrepreneurship Forum|accessdate=14 June 2013}}</ref>
===MicroMBA MB=== To help organizations benefit from the innovative ability of their employees Cohen has designed and implemented the MicroMBA MB program. Combining the IpOp Model with the fundamentals taught in an executive MBA, the MicroMBA MB enables middle managers to become proactive agents of change. Participants in the program must identify and implement a real project that supports the strategy of their employer. These projects translate into a measurable return of investment for the organization, turning training into a profit center.<ref>{{cite web|title=Turning Caterpillars Into Agile And Passionate Butterflies|url=http://www.winning-opportunities.org/?page_id=74|work=Winning Opportunities|accessdate=14 June 2013}}</ref>
==Awards and honors== * 1971 - Topali Award for special research in natural sciences (biology) * 1972 - Gillet Award for the highest ranking Maturité graduating scientific student in Geneva * 1972 - Hentsch Award for the best French essay in Geneva * 1983 - Award from the Geneva Chamber of Commerce for Meaningful Contribution to Swiss Economy
==Bibliography== *"Modèle de comptabilisation des transactions en devises", Economica, Paris, 1985<ref>{{cite web|title=Modèle De Comptabilisation Des Transactions En Devises|url=https://books.google.com/books/about/Mod%C3%A8le_de_comptabilisation_des_transact.html?id=T-LyNAAACAAJ|work=Google|accessdate=15 June 2013}}</ref> *”Concevoir et lancer un projet”, Cohen, Raphael, Editions d’organisation, Paris, 2006<ref>{{cite web|title=Turning Caterpillars Into Agile And… Passionate Butterflies|url=http://www.winning-opportunities.org/?page_id=74|work=Winning Opportunities|accessdate=15 June 2013}}</ref> * “Winning Opportunities, proven tools for converting your projects into success (without a business plan)”, Cohen, Raphael H, www.winning-opportunities.org, 2011.<ref>{{cite web|title=Turning Caterpillars Into Agile And… Passionate Butterflies|url=http://www.winning-opportunities.org/?page_id=74|work=Winning Opportunities|accessdate=15 June 2013}}</ref>
==Academic diplomas== * 1975 Licence en Sciences Commerciales et Industrielles - Université de Genève *1982 Doctorat en Sciences Economiques (Ph.D.), University of Geneva<ref>{{cite web|title=Cohen Raphael|url=http://www.hec.unige.ch/index.php?option=com_k2&view=item&layout=item&id=126&Itemid=423&lang=en|work=Université de Genève}}</ref> * 1988 Diploma of the Institute of Real-estate Studies - post graduate degree in real estate, Geneva
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.getratex.ch/left3_1.html Official Bio] *[http://www.winning-opportunities.org Book ](free download)
{{Use mdy dates|date=August 2011}} {{Authority control}}

revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=December 2011}} {{Infobox person | name = Ruben Rausing | image = Tetra Pak founder Ruben Rausing.jpg | alt = | caption = | birth_name = Anders Ruben Andersson | birth_date = {{Birth date|df=yes|1895|06|17}} | birth_place = [[Råå]], [[Sweden]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|df=yes|1983|10|08|1895|06|17}} | death_place = | nationality = | other_names = | alma_mater = [[Stockholm School of Economics]]
[[Columbia University]] | occupation = | known_for = Founder of [[Tetra Pak]]. }} '''Anders Ruben Rausing'''{{Cite web|url=https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:KFFR-XSJ|title=Immigration papers for Rio de Janeiro, Brazil|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=}} ({{IPA-sv|ˈrʉːbɛn ²raʊsɪŋ|-|Sv-Ruben_Rausing.ogg}}; [[Name at birth|né]] Andersson; 17 June 1895 – 8 October 1983) was the founder of the [[liquid]] [[food]] [[packaging]] company [[Tetra Pak]]. ==Early life== Anders Ruben Andersson was born in 1895 in [[Råå]], a small fishing hamlet in the district of Raus outside of [[Helsingborg]] in the south of [[Sweden]], to August and Mathilda Andersson. His father ran a small but successful business as a master painter.Leander, Lars, ''Tetra Pak. A Vision Becomes Reality. A company history with a difference'', Lund: Tetra Pak International 1996 ({{ISBN|91-630-4789-6}}), pp. 13 and 20 Rausing went to Upper Secondary School in [[Helsingborg]], graduating in 1915.Idem When doing his military service, Rausing, at the time still called (Anders) Ruben Andersson, was allegedly nicknamed ''rausingen'' by his fellow servicemen, meaning "the lad from Raus".Idem Taking a liking to this name, he eventually changed his surname from Andersson to Rausing. Another alleged reason for changing the family name is that the name of the parish in Råå, where they lived, was Raus. The change took place in 1921.{{Cite web|url=http://wallencpa.com/blog/tag/a-rausing-is-a-rausing-is-a-rausing|title=A Rausing is a Rausing is a Rausing|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120715060246/http://wallencpa.com/blog/tag/a-rausing-is-a-rausing-is-a-rausing/|archive-date=2012-07-15|dead-url=yes|access-date=}} ==Career== With the help of a loan from his aunt, Rausing studied at the recently founded [[Stockholm School of Economics|Stockholm School of Economics and Business Administration]], graduating in 1918.[http://www.hhs.se/se/BusinessAndSociety/Documents/4.pdf Ruben Rausing] Stockholm School of Economics and Business Administration 1909-2009, retrieved 2 November 2011Leander, Lars, ''Tetra Pak. A Vision Becomes Reality. A company history with a difference'', Lund: Tetra Pak International 1996 ({{ISBN|91-630-4789-6}}), p. 17 After a brief engagement at the privately owned [[Stockholms Enskilda Bank]], Rausing was employed by Sveriges Litografiska Tryckerier, SLT (later renamed [[Esselte]]), a well-known printing company. In 1919 he earned a scholarship from [[Stockholm School of Economics|SSE]] to continue his studies at [[Columbia University]] in [[New York City|New York]] and obtained a [[MSc]] in [[Economics]] in 1920.Idem[http://www.tetrapak.com/about_tetra_pak/the_company/history/pages/ourfounder.aspx Ruben Rausing] Tetrapak.com, retrieved 1 November 2011 Experiencing self-service grocery stores for the first time during his stay in America, Rausing realised that this system, yet unknown in Europe, was going to be part of a new way of retailing.[http://www.answers.com/topic/tetra-pak-international-s-a Tetra Pak International S.A.] Frederick C. Ingram in ''The Gale Directory of Company Histories'', retrieved 30 October 2011[http://www.tetrapak.com/about_tetra_pak/the_company/history/pages/ourfounder.aspx Ruben Rausing] Tetrapak.com, retrieved 1 November 2011 Returning to Sweden in 1920, Rausing continued his employment at SLT, first as a Manager Assistant and then as a Manager. During his time at SLT, Rausing became closely acquainted with the industrialist Erik Åkerlund and in 1929 Rausing left SLT to form a new packaging company together with Åkerlund in [[Malmö]], Åkerlund & Rausing. Åkerlund & Rausing was the first packaging company in Scandinavia and eventually became a leading manufacturer of dry food carton packages.[http://www.tetrapak.com/about_tetra_pak/the_company/history/pages/ourfounder.aspx Ruben Rausing] Tetrapak.com, retrieved 1 November 2011Leander, Lars, ''Tetra Pak. A Vision Becomes Reality. A company history with a difference'', Lund: Tetra Pak International 1996 ({{ISBN|91-630-4789-6}}), p. 20 Initially, however, the company had difficulties making profits and in 1933 Åkerlund sold his share to Rausing, who became the sole owner.Leander, Lars, ''Tetra Pak. A Vision Becomes Reality. A company history with a difference'', Lund: Tetra Pak International 1996 ({{ISBN|91-630-4789-6}}), p. 18 At the time, non-carbonated drinks such as milk and juices were sold in heavy and cumbersome glass bottles and Rausing was determined to find a way of implementing the new, modern packaging technology, spending a lot of resources on developing new concepts.Leander, Lars, ''Tetra Pak. A Vision Becomes Reality. A company history with a difference'', Lund: Tetra Pak International 1996 ({{ISBN|91-630-4789-6}}), p. 18 With the aim of producing a carton container for liquid foods, similar to the hygienic and practical wax-coated paper cartons Rausing had seen overseas, Åkerlund & Rausing created the plastic-coated carton [[tetrahedron]], patented on 27 March 1944.Idem p. 27Sedig, Kjell, ''Swedish Innovations'', Stockholm: The Swedish Institute 2002 ({{ISBN|91-520-0910-6}}), p. 45 In 1951 there was still no viable packaging material for the new package, and efforts to develop packaging material increased.Leander, Lars, ''Tetra Pak. A Vision Becomes Reality. A company history with a difference'', Lund: Tetra Pak International 1996 ({{ISBN|91-630-4789-6}}), appendix p. vii Finally, in 1952, the first machine producing [[tetrahedron]] cream packages was sold to Lundabygdens Mejeri, a local dairy.Idem The new packaging system was not an immediate success and the company had difficulties throughout the 1950s, with Rausing continuing to spend large amounts on development. Initially catering primarily to the Swedish market, the company expanded gradually, with [[Germany]] (1954), [[France]] (1954) and [[Italy]] (1956) as its first export markets.Leander, Lars, ''Tetra Pak. A Vision Becomes Reality. A company history with a difference'', Lund: Tetra Pak International 1996 ({{ISBN|91-630-4789-6}}), pp. 195, 165 and 179 Tetra Pak's commercial break-through did not arrive until the mid-60s with the new [[Tetra Brik]] package, introduced in 1963, and the development of the [[aseptic processing|Aseptic technology]].Sedig, Kjell, ''Swedish Innovations'', Stockholm: The Swedish Institute 2002 ({{ISBN|91-520-0910-6}}), p. 45 The late 1960s and the 1970s saw a global expansion of the company, much due to the new [[Tetra Brik Aseptic]] package, debuted in 1968, which opened up new markets in the developing world and sparked off a virtual explosion in sales.[http://www.answers.com/topic/tetra-pak-international-s-a Tetra Pak International S.A.] Frederick C. Ingram in ''The Gale Directory of Company Histories'', retrieved 30 October 2011 After 30 years, Rausing's venture was successful and Tetra Pak eventually became one of the leading food processing and packaging company in the world.[http://www.packagingeurope.com/Packaging-Europe-News/44268/Tetra-Pak-launches-nextgeneration-cheese-production-unit.html Tetra Pak launches next generation cheese production unit] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924063133/http://www.packagingeurope.com/Packaging-Europe-News/44268/Tetra-Pak-launches-nextgeneration-cheese-production-unit.html |date=24 September 2015 }} Packaging Europe News, retrieved 11 November 2011 ==Honours== Rausing was made [[Doctor Honoris Causa]] in [[Medicine]] at [[Lund University]] in 1957, in [[Economics]] at the [[Stockholm School of Economics|Stockholm School of Economics and Business Administration]] in 1959 and in [[Technology]] at the [[Royal Institute of Technology]] in 1977.[http://runeberg.org/vemardet/1969/0802.html Ruben Rausing] Who's Who 1969 (Swedish), retrieved 2 November 2011[http://www.kth.se/om/fame/hedersdoktorer/hedersdoktorer-1944-2009-1.3974 The Royal Institute of Technology] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111024222513/http://www.kth.se/om/fame/hedersdoktorer/hedersdoktorer-1944-2009-1.3974 |date=24 October 2011 }} List of Honorary Doctors, retrieved 2 November 2011 He was a member of the [[Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences]] (Ingenjörsvetenskapsakademin, IVA). ==Personal life== Ruben Rausing was married to Elisabeth (née Varenius) and had three sons, [[Hans Rausing|Hans]], [[Gad Rausing|Gad]] and Sven. For tax reasons, Rausing left Sweden for [[Rome]] in 1969. All his life, however, he kept his country home Simontorp, near Lund. ==See also== * [[Rausing family]] ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== *[http://www.tetrapak.com Tetra Pak Homepage] {{Authority control}} {{Swedish entrepreneurs}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rausing, Ruben}} [[Category:1895 births]] [[Category:1983 deaths]] [[Category:Columbia University alumni]] [[Category:Swedish businesspeople]] [[Category:Stockholm School of Economics alumni]] [[Category:People from Helsingborg]] [[Category:Rausing family|Ruben]]

clean up, [[WP:AWB/T|typo(s) fixed]]: Queen’s → Queen's
revision.text:
{{Infobox person |name = Samuel Edward Dawson |image = |caption = |birth_date = {{Birth date|1833|06|01}} |birth_place = [[City of Halifax|Halifax]], [[Nova Scotia]], Canada |death_date = {{Death date and age|1916|02|09|1833|06|01}} |death_place = [[Westmount, Quebec|Westmount]], [[Quebec]], Canada |other_names = |alma_mater = |known_for = |occupation = Author
Businessman
Civil servant
Publisher |title = President of the [[Royal Society of Canada]] |term = 1907–1908 |predecessor = [[William Saunders (scientist)|William Saunders]] |successor = [[Joseph-Edmond Roy]] }} '''Samuel Edward Dawson''', {{Post-nominals|country=CAN|CMG|FRSC}} (June 1, 1833 – February 9, 1916) was a [[Canadians|Canadian]] businessman, publisher, author, and civil servant. Born in [[City of Halifax|Halifax]], [[Nova Scotia]], the son of Benjamin Dawson and Elizabeth Gardner, Dawson moved with his family to [[Montreal]] in 1847. Dawson worked with his father in his father's bookstore called Benjamin Dawson and Son. After his father retired in 1860, Dawson went into a partnership with his brother and the firm was renamed Dawson Brothers. In 1889, Dawson left the firm. Dawson was a founder of the Dominion Note Company in 1879 and of the Montreal News Company. In 1891, he was appointed Queen's Printer which was equivalent as a deputy minister. He retired in 1908. He was created a Companion of the [[Order of St Michael and St George]] in 1906. In 1893, he was made a Fellow of the [[Royal Society of Canada]] and served as its president from 1907 to 1908. ==References== * {{Canadabio|ID=7324}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dawson, Samuel}} [[Category:1833 births]] [[Category:1916 deaths]] [[Category:Canadian businesspeople]] [[Category:19th-century Canadian civil servants]] [[Category:Canadian Companions of the Order of St Michael and St George]] [[Category:Fellows of the Royal Society of Canada]] [[Category:People from Halifax, Nova Scotia]] {{Canada-business-bio-stub}}

revision.comment: standard quote handling in WP;standard Apostrophe/quotation marks in WP; MOS general fixes using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
{{BLP sources|date=December 2017}}
{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2011}} {{Infobox officeholder |name = Serhiy Rybalka |native_name = Сергій Рибалка |native_name_lang = uk |image = |office1 = [[People's Deputy of Ukraine]] [[Verkhovna Rada]] |convocation1 = [[8th Ukrainian Verkhovna Rada|8th convocation]] |term_start = 10 September 2014 |term_end = |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1978|7|22|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Dnipropetrovsk]], [[Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic|Ukrainian SSR]], [[Soviet Union]] |citizenship = {{UKR}} |nationality = Ukraine |death_date = |death_place = |party = [[Radical Party of Oleh Lyashko]] }}
'''Serhiy Victorovych Rybalka''' ({{lang-uk|Сергій Вікторович Рибалка}}, aka Serhiy Rybalka, Sergey Rybalka) (born on 22 July 1978, [[Dnipropetrovsk]]) is a Ukrainian politician and member of parliament of Ukraine. He is a Chairman of the Committee of the [[Verkhovna Rada]] of Ukraine on financial policy and banking activity and former Deputy Minister of Ecology of Ukraine, former Deputy Head of the National Agency of Ukraine on preparation and holding of the final part of the [[2012 European Football Championship]]. Member of groups of inter-parliamentary relations with parliaments of the United States of America, the United Arab Emirates, China, Austria, Kazakhstan, Georgia, Uzbekistan. Head of the Council of the National Professional Boxing League.
== Early life and Family == Serhiy Rybalka was born on 22 July 1978 in [[Dnipropetrovsk]] in the family of Victor and Yevheniia Rybalka. He started his first business in the mid-1990s. His brother Dmytro is now the head of the family business,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.radiosvoboda.org/a/28036312.html|title=Офшорний Рибалка (розслідування)|last=|first=|date=|website=radiosvoboda.org|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> Victor and Yevheniia are also involved in the company's management.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://agravery.com/uk/posts/show/nove-zitta-pisla-rozlucenna-istoria-sgroup|title=Нове життя після розлучення: історія S.Group|last=|first=|date=|website=agravery.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
In 2000 he graduated from [[National Metallurgical Academy of Ukraine]] with a degree in Metallurgy of ferrous metals.
In 2003 he graduated from Law Academy of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Ukraine with a degree in Jurisprudence.
In 2006 he married Hanna Butkevych, the daughter of Ukrainian tycoon Hennadii Butkevych, one of three co-owners of ATB-Market, the largest supermarket chain in Ukraine. In 2009 their daughter Roksolana was born. In 2013 Serhii and Hanna got divorced.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.obozrevatel.com/crime/30689-kak-oligarhi-semejnyie-konfliktyi-reshayut.htm|title=Как олигархи семейные конфликты решают|last=|first=|date=|website=obozrevatel.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> This resulted in a business dispute between ATB and the companies of Rybalka's family and in criminal persecution by police and security service authorities. They continued and intensified after Serhii Rybalka was elected a member of parliament in 2014.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://kp.ua/economics/591667-delo-rybalky-chetyre-hoda-falsyfykatsyi-polnaia-khronolohyia|title=Дело Рыбалки: четыре года фальсификаций. Полная хронология|last=|first=|date=|website=kp.ua|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
==Business== In 1995, as a student, he and his partner, Ivan Omelchenko, founded a private enterprise in the wholesale and retail trade sphere .
From 2001 to 2003 he worked as an engineer on occupational safety, the head of the occupational protection department for Kabliuk A.V. private company.
In 2000, Serhiy Rybalka and his partner, Ivan Omelchenko, set up "Snack Export" company that then became the leader in the snack market of Ukraine. The company is the owner of several brand names: "Semki", "Kozatska rozvaga", "Flint", "Macho" and "Morski".
From 2002 to January 2005 he acted as Director of Legal Affairs at Limited Liability Company "Markom".
In January 2005 he started to work as a Director of Legal Affairs at Limited Liability Company "Snack Export".
In July 2007 he became an Advisor to the Director General of Legal Affairs at Limited Liability Company "Snack Export". During this period, within the framework of "S.I. Group" other areas of business began to develop, such as transportation, development, distribution of goods, production of pulp and paper products.
After almost two-year break, he connected with work at the Ukrainian authorities.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://bp.ubr.ua/profile/rybalka-serhej-viktorovich--3856053|title=Рыбалка Сергей Викторович|last=|first=|date=|website=bp.ubr.ua|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> In March 2010 he returned to business and took the post of Advisor to the Director General of Legal Affairs in "S.I. Group" corporation.
From August to November 2014, Serhiy Rybalka worked as an Advisor to the Director General of Legal Affairs at the company "Snack Export".
In September 2014, as a result of political persecution and actions of his former father-in-law Hennadii Butkevych, "S.I. Group" was reorganized.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://kp.ua/economics/591667-delo-rybalky-chetyre-hoda-falsyfykatsyi-polnaia-khronolohyia|title=Дело Рыбалки: четыре года фальсификаций. Полная хронология|last=|first=|date=|website=kp.ua|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> Serhiy Rybalka and Ivan Omelchenko decided on splitting the corporation into two equal parts.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://forbes.net.ua/magazine/forbes/1381849-poveliteli-zakuski|title=Повелители закуски|last=|first=|date=|website=forbes.net.ua|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> The new company of Serhiy Rybalka was named "S. Group".<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://delo.ua/business/pochemu-razhodjatsja-sobstvenniki-krupnejshego-ukrainskogo-proiz-278078/|title=Почему "расходятся" собственники крупнейшего украинского производителя снэков|last=|first=|date=|website=delo.ua|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
Since Serhii became a People's Deputy, the new group of companies is now run by his family under the name S. Group.
==Political career== In 2002 and 2006 he was elected a member of the Dnipropetrovsk City Council. He held position as a secretary of the standing commission on issues of legality, law enforcement, and security.
In 17 April 2008, by the order of the [[Government of Ukraine]] he was appointed as a Deputy Head of the National Agency of Ukraine on preparation and holding of the final part of the [[2012 European Football Championship]]. At this position he was in charge of working with regions.<ref>[http://www.kmu.gov.ua/control/uk/cardnpd?docid=127280447 On the appointment of Rybalka S.V. as a Deputy Head of the National Agency of Ukraine on the preparation and holding of the final part of the 2012 European Football Championship in Ukraine]</ref>
In January 2010, Serhiy Rybalka was appointed as a Deputy Minister of Environmental Protection of Ukraine with the Order of Government ([[Second Tymoshenko government]]).<ref>[http://zakon2.rada.gov.ua/laws/show/ru/66-2009-%D1%80 On the appointment of Rybalka S.V. as a Deputy Minister of Environmental Protection of Ukraine]</ref>
Аt the extraordinary parliamentary elections, which took place on 26 October 2014, Serhiy Rybalka was elected as a deputy of the Parliament of [[Radical Party of Oleh Lyashko]].<ref>[http://www.cvk.gov.ua/pls/vnd2014/WP602?PT001F01=910&pf7171=144&pf7331=0 Extraordinary elections of people's deputies of Ukraine on 26 October 2014]</ref>
He is a former Head of the Committee on Financial Policy and Banking at the Parliament. As head of the Committee, he initiated a number of draft laws in the field of investment, banking, and financial sector.
He is also a member of the groups on inter-parliamentary relations with the [[United States of America]], the United Arab Emirates, China, Austria, Kazakhstan, Georgia, Uzbekistan.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://itd.rada.gov.ua/mps/info/page/18053|title=Page of Serhii Rybalka at the site of Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine|last=|first=|date=|website=itd.rada.gov.ua|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
==Activity in Financial Committee==
Serhii Rybalka chaired VR Financial Policy and Banking Committee based on political quota of the Radical Party of Oleh Lyashko, which was a part of democratic coalition until the autumn 2015. After withdrawal of the faction from the coalition, all faction members that chaired parliamentary committees turned in their resignations.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.unian.info/politics/1117546-lyashko-faction-quits-coalition.html|title=Lyashko faction quits coalition|last=|first=|date=|website=unian.info|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> These resignations, however, were not considered by the Regulatory Committee and the Verkhovna Rada for two years.
As the chair of the financial policy and banking committee, Serhii Rybalka focused on the reforms in the banking sector. Specifically, under his leadership, a group of highly respected experts, employees of NBU, commercial banks, economists and scholars developed the Strategy of Banking Sector Development in Ukraine until 2020.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://rada.gov.ua/en/news/news/News/128709.html|title=Draft Strategy for developing Ukrainian banking system presented at round table at Committee on Financial Policy and Banking|last=|first=|date=|website=rada.gov.ua|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
This was the first time, when the parliamentary committee initiated its own strategy for a whole industry. The document was approved at the meeting of the committee and recommended for the introduction to the parliament and the government of Ukraine.
The strategy provided an analysis of the operation of the National bank in relation to providing stability of the national currency – hryvnia for the first time (which is its constitutional obligation), withdrawing problem banks from the market (in 2014-2017, over 90 banks, which is half of all banking institutions in the country, were withdrawn from the market). In addition, it provided analysis of the factors suppressing financing of the economy, absence of export support and the role of state banks in the financial system of Ukraine.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.forum-strategy.com/draft-strategy|title=Draft of the Strategy|last=|first=|date=|website=forum-strategy.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
The strategy proposed to increase transparency of NBU's operation, introduce instruments to encourage development of hi-tech productions, activate financing, increase liability for violating banking laws, in particular bankrupting a bank. Rybalka and experts also proposed to create a number of development institutes on the basis of state banks to support not only big businesses, but also small and medium enterprises, improve domestic demand, support exporters and develop hi-tech branches of production.
With Serhii Rybalka as the chair of the committee, an open competition for the positions of members of the NBU Council, a supervisory constitutional body the controls how NBU exercises its authority, was introduced for the first time. Specifically, the committee reviewed programs of candidates from different political forces, before making a recommendation to the Verkhovna Rada on the candidates to be approved as the members of the NBU Council by the parliament's quota.
Also, in 2014-2017, Rybalka and VR Committee on Financial Policy and Banking drafted and introduced to the Verkhovna Rada a number of draft laws aimed at reforming the financial sector.
Specifically, these include draft laws on improving trust towards the banking system, on the deposit guarantee system for individuals, on supporting export, on minimum size of banks' capital, on credit register, on improving transparency of operation of the National Bank, on protection of rights of consumers of financial services, on stimulating financing in Ukraine.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://serhiyrybalka.com/a_unified_credit_registry_will_strengthen_the_banking_system|title=Serhiy Rybalka: "A unified credit registry will strengthen the banking system"|last=|first=|date=|website=serhiyrybalka.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> Implementation of a number of reforms, reflected in these draft laws, is a part of requirements of the International Monetary Fund within the package of the reforms that must be implemented in order to continue cooperation with Ukraine along with the demand to create anti-corruption court.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ukranews.com/en/news/534623-financial-sector-reform-is-needed-for-ukraine-not-for-western-creditors-serhii-rybalka|title=Financial sector reform is needed for Ukraine, not for Western creditors – Serhii Rybalka|last=|first=|date=|website=ukranews.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
In addition, under Rybalka's leadership, the Committee initiated the development of draft laws regulating circulation of cryptocurrency in Ukraine.[[Serhiy Rybalka (politician)#cite note-4|<sup>[4]</sup>]] The draft law envisages introduction of instruments of protection of unqualified investors and also preferential conditions for development of blockchain infrastructure.
However, the parliament's unwillingness to introduce financial reforms, including those initiated by the committee chaired by Rybalka, resulted into suspension of financial assistance to Ukraine from the international partners.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ukranews.com/en/news/537490-we-need-a-more-united-effort-to-push-for-reforms-serhii-rybalka-at-the-general-meeting-of-the|title=We need a more united effort to push for reforms – Serhii Rybalka|last=|first=|date=|website=ukranews.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
==Activity as a member of USA-Ukraine inter-parliamentary group==
Serhii Rybalka as the Chair of the VR Committee on Financial Policy and Banking and a member of the USA-Ukraine inter-parliamentary group regularly pays working visits to Washington. In 2017, he met with a number of chairs of committees of the US Congress, held a number of meetings at the IMF, IRI, Heritage Foundation.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ukranews.com/en/news/535987-mp-rybalka-spoke-in-washington-dc-about-corruption-and-the-sabotage-of-reforms-in-ukraine|title=MP Rybalka spoke in Washington D.C. about corruption and the sabotage of reforms in Ukraine|last=|first=|date=|website=ukranews.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
The issues discussed at the meetings included reforms progress in the sphere of finance and also law enforcement and judicial systems, U.S. experience in supporting small and medium enterprises as well as high level of political corruption in the contest of creating and organizing the work of the anti-corruption court.
==Political Persecution==
Since 2013 his family's business and Rybalka himself have been persecuted for his political activity. Specifically, the media reported the first searches in January 2014. Later, the family's company was accused of tax evasion, drug trade, illegal surveillance, fraud and many other crimes, although every time none of these accusations were proven in court.
Moreover, there have also been murder attempts against Rybalka and his close ally, S.Group top manager Serhiy Bilyy.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.epravda.com.ua/rus/news/2017/01/11/617249/|title=S.Group accuses "ATB-Market" of attempted murder of the top-manager of the company|last=|first=|date=|website=epravda.com.ua|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> One of the financial managers of the company Iryna Savytska is also being persecuted; she is currently under arrest in Georgia on trumped-up charges of fraudulent actions. American media has written a lot about it.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.ocregister.com/2017/09/03/the-casualties-of-business-warfare-in-eastern-europe-have-a-human-face/|title=The casualties of business warfare in Eastern Europe have a human face|last=|first=|date=|website=ocregister.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2017/oct/25/family-feud-ukraine-turns-ugly-shades-james-comeys/|title=Family feud in Ukraine turns ugly; Showing shades of James Comey's FBI?|last=|first=|date=|website=washingtontimes.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2017/oct/19/iryna-savytskaya-case-deserves-the-attention-of-fe/|title=A case of abuse feminists should really care about|last=|first=|date=|website=washingtontimes.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
In an interview for The Washington Times, former employee of Prosecutor General Office of Ukraine Dmytro Sus told how the PGO employees falsified cases against Rybalka and company. Hennadii Butkevych could have been behind these falsified cases, said Sus.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RgLW7lwIsec&t=565s|title=Dmytro Sus talks to American journalist|last=|first=|date=|website=youtube.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
At the moment, the National Anticorruption Bureau of Ukraine initiated criminal proceedings regarding these facts.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ukranews.com/en/news/534180-national-anti-corruption-bureau-of-ukraine-initiated-investigation-on-fabrication-of-criminal-cases|title=National Anti-Corruption Bureau of Ukraine initiated investigation on fabrication of criminal cases against MP Rybalka|last=|first=|date=|website=ukranews.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Rybalka, Serhiy}} [[Category:1978 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Radical Party (Ukraine) politicians]] [[Category:Eighth convocation members of the Verkhovna Rada]] [[Category:Ukrainian businesspeople]] [[Category:People from Dnipro]] [[Category:National Metallurgical Academy of Ukraine alumni]]

revision.text:
A {{nihongo|'''shihainin'''|支配人||lit. "manager"}} is an authorized representative of a [[company]] or unincorporated [[business]] under [[Japan]]ese [[commercial law]].
A shihainin has full legal authority to represent the company/business at the place of business to which the shihainin is assigned.<ref>[http://www.houko.com/00/01/M32/048.HTM Commercial Code], article 21; [http://www.cas.go.jp/jp/seisaku/hourei/data/CA1_4_2.pdf Companies Act], article 11.</ref> This authority may be restricted, but any restriction is unassertable against a third party acting in good faith.<ref>[http://www.houko.com/00/01/M32/048.HTM Commercial Code], article 21.3.</ref>
The status is often granted to the managers of regional or local offices of the company, as well as to managers at the head office. Directors and [[corporate officer]]s (but not [[statutory auditor]]s) may be granted shihainin status in addition to any other titles they hold within the company. The term can lead to confusion in translation, as the literal translation of "manager" may be confused with internal "manager" titles that do not necessarily denote shihainin status.
In most businesses, the term is mainly used in corporate legal documents. However, it is popular in certain industries, such as [[hotel]]s and [[restaurant]]s, as the sole designation for the manager of a particular property.
Company shihainin are generally appointed by the [[board of director]]s.<ref>[http://www.cas.go.jp/jp/seisaku/hourei/data/CA1_4_2.pdf Companies Act], article 348.3.</ref> Their name, date of birth, residential address and place of business is recorded in the [[commercial register]] at the [[Legal Affairs Bureau]] and kept as [[public record]].<ref>[http://www.houko.com/00/01/M32/048.HTM Commercial Code], article 22; [http://www.cas.go.jp/jp/seisaku/hourei/data/CA1_4_2.pdf Companies Act], article 918; [http://www.houko.com/00/01/S38/125.HTM Commercial Registration Act], article 43.</ref>
==References==
<references />
[[Category:Japanese business law]] [[Category:Japanese business terms]]
